description: Establishes ability-to-repay requirements and defines qualified mortgages that receive legal protections

key_requirements.rule: For General QM loans, lenders must verify and document the consumer's debt-to-income ratio or residual income
key_requirements.threshold: No fixed DTI cap; replaced with price-based approach
key_requirements.notes: Loans must not exceed APR threshold to qualify for QM safe harbor

key_requirements.rule: Lenders must verify income and assets using third-party records
QM loans cannot have certain risky features
prohibited_features: Points and fees exceeding 3% of loan amount

risk_implications.compliant_loans: Receive safe harbor or rebuttable presumption of compliance with ATR rule
risk_implications.non_compliant_loans: Subject to borrower legal challenge on ability-to-repay determination

issuing_authority: Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)
description: Prohibits discrimination in housing-related transactions including mortgage lending

key_requirements.rule: Cannot discriminate based on protected characteristics
Specific lending practices that are prohibited

risk_implications.compliance: All lending decisions must be based on creditworthiness factors only
risk_implications.violations: Subject to civil penalties, lawsuits, and regulatory action

description: Requires specific disclosures to consumers for residential mortgage transactions

key_requirements.rule: Must be provided within 3 business days of receiving application
Must be provided at least 3 business days before closing
Specific waiting periods must be observed
key_requirements.details: Changes to APR, loan product, or prepayment penalty require new 3-day waiting period

risk_implications.compliance: Proper disclosures protect lender from rescission and liability
risk_implications.violations: Consumer may have extended right to rescind; regulatory penalties

description: Requires collection and reporting of mortgage lending data to identify discriminatory practices

key_requirements.rule: Must collect and report specific data points on mortgage applications
Annual submission required by March 1 for prior calendar year

risk_implications.compliance: Data used by regulators to monitor fair lending compliance

description: Requirements for loans to be eligible for purchase by Fannie Mae

key_requirements.rule: Minimum credit standards for conventional conforming loans

details.maximum_dti: 45% with DU approval, 50% with compensating factors

key_requirements.rule: Specific documentation required for all loans

risk_implications.compliance: Loans eligible for sale to Fannie Mae provide liquidity
risk_implications.non_compliance: Loans may need to be held in portfolio or sold at discount
